Literature Review: Lineage tracing has emerged as a crucial tool for understanding the complex dynamics of tumor evolution in cancer. The ability to track the clonal expansion and diversification of cancer cells has significant implications for our understanding of cancer biology and the development of effective therapeutic strategies. In this review, we provide an overview of the current state of lineage tracing in cancer, with a focus on recent advances in single-cell analysis and in vivo applications.
